text: The Iron Bridge was the first arch bridge in the world to be made out of cast iron.UNESCO, "Ironbridge Gorge"; retrieved 2012-4-25. It crosses the River Severn at the Ironbridge Gorge near the village of Ironbridge, in Shropshire, England. The bridge is part of a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is maintained by English Heritage who launched a crowdfunding campaign in 2017 to support a conservation project which began in 2018. As well as repairing rusted parts of the bridge, it was painted red to match a painting from 1777 showing how the Iron Bridge looked soon after it was finished. ==Gallery== File:Ironbridge construction at Blists Hill - geograph.org.uk - 1754320.jpg|This is a reconstruction showing how the arches of the Iron Bridge were put together File:Ironbridge - geograph.org.uk - 270796.jpg|Buildings which were a context for the Iron Bridge in 1988 == Related pages == * List of World Heritage Sites of the United Kingdom * Ironbridge Gorge ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Bridges in England Category:World Heritage Sites in the United Kingdom Category:Buildings and structures in Shropshire Category:18th- century buildings and structures Category:Arch bridges
